sen.j: タコ（蛸、鮹、章魚、鱆、 英名 Octopus）は、軟体動物門 頭足綱 八腕形上目 タコ目に分類される動物の総称。
sen.e: Octopus is the general term for animals categorized in Mollusca Cephalopoda Octopodoformes Octopoda.
Octopus is the general term for animals categorized in Mollusca Cephalopoda Octopodoformes Octopoda.
Octopus is the general term for animals categorized in Mollusca Cephalopoda Octopodoformes Octopoda.

sen.j: 海洋性の軟体動物で、主に岩礁や砂地で活動する。
sen.e: It is a marine mollusk that mainly lives in shore reefs and sandy areas.
It is a marine mollusk that mainly lives in shore reefs and sandy areas.
It is a marine mollusk that mainly lives in shore reefs and sandy areas.

sen.j: 多様な種が知られているが、一般的にタコといえばマダコを指す場合が多い。
sen.e: Though various species are known, the term octopus usually refers to a common octopus.
Though various species are known, the term octopus usually refers to a common octopus.
Though various species are known, the term octopus usually refers to a common octopus.

sen.j: 複数の吸盤がついた8本の触手を特徴とする。
sen.e: It is characterized by eight tentacles having multiple suckers.
It is characterized by eight tentacles having multiple suckers.
It is characterized by eight tentacles having multiple suckers.

sen.j: 一般には足と呼ばれるが、学術書などでは腕と表現されることが多い（英語でも arm （腕）と呼ぶ）。
sen.e: Though the tentacles are generally referred to as legs, they are often expressed as arms in academic books (as is the case in English).
Though the tentacles are generally referred to as legs, they are often expressed as arms in academic books (as is the case in English).
Though the tentacles are generally referred to as legs, they are often expressed as arms in academic books (as is the case in English).

sen.j: Octopus（英語）／Octopoda（スペイン語）などつづりはギリシア語の「8本足（oktopous ← ὀκτώπους）」に由来する。
sen.e: The spellings for "octopus" (English) and "octopoda" (Spanish) come from the Greek word 'Eight-legged (oktopous; ὀκτώπους)'.
The spellings for "octopus" (English) and "octopoda" (Spanish) come from the Greek word 'Eight-legged (oktopous; ὀκτώπους)'.
The spellings for "octopus" (English) and "octopoda" (Spanish) come from the Greek word 'Eight-legged' (oktopous; ὀκτώπους).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 無脊椎動物の中で最も高い知能を持っていて、色を見分け、形を認識する事や、問題を学習し解決する事ができる。
sen.e: It has the highest intelligence as an invertebrata and can distinguish colors, recognize shapes, as well as learn and solve problems.
It has the highest intelligence of any invertebrate and can distinguish colors, recognize shapes, as well as learn and solve problems.
It has the highest intelligence of any invertebrate and can distinguish colors, recognize shapes, as well as learn and solve problems.

sen.j: 身を守るためには、保護色に変色し、地形に合わせて体型を変える、その色や形を2年ほど記憶できることが知られている。
sen.e: It is known that the animal can take on a protective coloring and change its shape according to the geographical features to protect itself, and remember that coloring and shape or about two years.
It is known that the animal can take on a protective coloring and change its shape according to the geographical features to protect itself, and remember that coloring and shape for about two years.
It is known that the animal can take on a protective coloring and change its shape according to the geographical features to protect itself, and remember that coloring and shape for about two years.

sen.j: その柔軟な体のほとんどは筋肉であり、時には強力な力を発揮する。
sen.e: Most of its flexible body is made up of muscles and can at times exert powerful strength.
Most of its flexible body is made up of muscles and can at times exert powerful strength.
Most of its flexible body is made up of muscles and can at times exert powerful strength.

sen.j: 寿命は短い。
sen.e: Its life span is short.
Its life span is short.
Its life span is short.

sen.j: 卵の管理が難しい等の理由で、日本での商業用の養殖はいまだ成功していない（2009年1月19日現在）。
sen.e: There is no successful commercial cultivation of octopus in Japan due to the difficulties involved in managing the eggs (as of January 19, 2009).
There is no successful commercial cultivation of octopus in Japan due to the difficulties involved in managing the eggs (as of January 19, 2009).
There is no successful commercial cultivation of octopus in Japan due to the difficulties involved in managing the eggs (as of January 19, 2009).

sen.j: 危険を感じると黒い墨を吐き、姿をくらます。
sen.e: When it senses danger, it spews black ink to conceal itself.
When it senses danger, it spews black ink to conceal itself.
When it senses danger, it spews black ink to conceal itself.

sen.j: この墨は、イカのそれと比べてうま味（特にアミノ酸）が豊富に含まれているが、粘性が低く水に溶けやすいという点と、墨汁嚢が取り出しにくいという点から、加工がしにくく料理には適さないとされる。
sen.e: This ink contains abundant umami (especially amino acid) when compared to that of a squid, but it is considered difficult to process and not fit for cooking since the ink has less viscosity and is easier to dissolve in water, in addition to the fact that the ink sac is difficult to take out.

This ink contains abundant umami (especially amino acid) when compared to that of a squid, but it is considered difficult to process and not fit for cooking since the ink has less viscosity and is easier to dissolve in water, in addition to the fact that the ink sac is difficult to take out.

sen.j: オスは吸盤の大きさがメスに比べばらつきがあり、また、8本の足のうち1本の先端は生殖器になっていて、これがメスの体内に挿入されることで受精が成立する（交接腕）。
sen.e: The suckers on a male vary in size when compared to that of a female, and of the eight legs, the tip of one of the legs acts as a reproductive organ; fertilization can occur when this arm enters a female body (copulatory arm).

The suckers on a male vary in size when compared to that of a female, and of the eight legs, the tip of one of the legs acts as a reproductive organ; fertilization can occur when this arm enters a female body (copulatory arm).

The suckers on a male vary in size when compared to that of a female, and of the eight legs, the tip of one of the legs acts as a reproductive organ; fertilization can occur when this arm enters a female body (copulatory arm).

sen.j: 外敵に襲われた時、捉えられた足を切り放して逃げることができ、その後、足は再生するが、時折2本に分かれて生えることもあり、8本超の足を持つタコも存在する。
sen.e: When attacked by an enemy, the octopus can cut loose the captured leg which is later regenerated, but at times this can grow into two legs, and an octopus with more than 8 legs is not uncommon.
When attacked by an enemy, the octopus can cut loose the captured leg which is later regenerated, but at times this can grow into two legs, and an octopus with more than 8 legs is not uncommon.
When attacked by an enemy, the octopus can cut loose the captured leg which is later regenerated, but at times this can grow into two legs, and an octopus with more than 8 legs is not uncommon.

sen.j: 極端なものでは日本で96本足のあるタコが捕獲されたことがあり、志摩マリンランドに標本として展示してある。
sen.e: As an extreme example, an octopus with 96 legs has been captured in Japan and it is currently being displayed as a specimen in Shima Marine Land aquarium.
As an extreme example, an octopus with 96 legs has been captured in Japan and it is currently being displayed as a specimen in Shima Marine Land aquarium.
As an extreme example, an octopus with 96 legs has been captured in Japan and it is currently being displayed as a specimen in Shima Marine Land aquarium.

sen.j: また、ストレスによって自分の足を食べることがあるが、このとき食べた足は再生しない。
sen.e: Also, there are cases in which it eats its own leg from stress, but in such a case, the leg does not regenerate.
Also, there are cases in which it eats its own leg from stress, but in such a case, the leg does not regenerate.
Also, there are cases in which it eats its own leg from stress, but in such a case, the leg does not regenerate.

sen.j: 一見頭に見える、丸く大きな部分は実は胴体であり、足の付け根部分が頭となる。
sen.e: The large round part that looks like a head at a glance is in fact a body, and the base of the legs is the head.
The large round part that looks like a head at a glance is in fact a body, and the base of the legs is the head.
The large round part that looks like a head at a glance is in fact a body, and the base of the legs is the head.

sen.j: すなわち、頭から足（腕）が生えていることになる（イカもそうだが、頭足綱の名の由来でもある）。
sen.e: In other words, it can be said that the legs (arms) are growing out of its head (which is also the case with squid, and the Japanese word for cephalopoda is derived from this fact).
In other words, it can be said that the legs (arms) are growing out of its head (which is also the case with squid, and the Japanese word for cephalopoda is derived from this fact).
In other words, it can be said that the legs (arms) are growing out of its head (which is also the case with squid, and the Japanese word for cephalopoda is derived from this fact).

sen.j: 血液中にはヘモシアニンという緑色の色素が含まれているので、血液は青く見える。
sen.e: Its blood looks blue since the blood contains green colored pigments called hemocyanins.
Its blood looks blue since the blood contains green colored pigments called hemocyanins.
Its blood looks blue since the blood contains green colored pigments called hemocyanins.

sen.j: タコは手近なタンパク質の供給源として、世界各地の沿岸地方で食用されている。
sen.e: As a commonly available source of protein, octopus has been consumed as food in coastal areas worldwide.
As a commonly available source of protein, octopus has been consumed as food in coastal areas worldwide.
As a commonly available source of protein, octopus has been consumed as food in coastal areas worldwide.

sen.j: ユダヤ教では食の規定カシュルートによって、タコは食べてはいけないとされる「鱗のない魚」に該当する。
sen.e: Octopus fall under 'fish without scales' and cannot be eaten according to the dietary laws of kashrut in Judaism.
Octopus fall under 'fish without scales' and cannot be eaten according to the dietary laws of kashrut in Judaism.
Octopus fall under 'fish without scales' and cannot be eaten according to the dietary laws of kashrut in Judaism.

sen.j: イスラム教やキリスト教の一部の教派でも類似の規定によって、タコを食べることが禁忌に触れると考えられている。
sen.e: In some sects of Islam and Christianity, consumption of octopus is considered to be a taboo due to similar laws.
In some sects of Islam and Christianity, consumption of octopus is considered to be a taboo due to similar laws.
In some sects of Islam and Christianity, consumption of octopus is considered to be a taboo due to similar laws.

sen.j: 日本
sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

sen.j: 池上・曽根遺跡などの大阪府下の弥生時代の遺跡からは、蛸壺型の土器が複数出土している。
sen.e: Many earthwares in the shape of an octopus trap pot have been excavated from the Yayoi period ruins such as the Ikegamisone Historic Site in Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 用語集にある蛸壺は"octopus fishing equipment"となっていますが、土器の形がその言葉のみでは不明なため、 "octopus trap"(三省堂他) + "pot" と訳しました。
sen.e: Man potteries in the shape of an octopus trap pot have been excavated from the Yayoi period ruins such as the Ikegamisone Historic Site in Osaka Prefecture.
Man potteries in the shape of an octopus trap pot have been excavated from the Yayoi period ruins such as the Ikegamisone Historic Site in Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 世界のタコ消費量の約六割を日本が占める。
sen.e: Japan accounts for about 60 percent of the world's octopus consumption.
Japan accounts for about 60 percent of the world's octopus consumption.
Japan accounts for about 60 percent of the world's octopus consumption.

sen.j: 近年はアフリカ、モロッコからの輸入が増加し、全体の六割を超えていたが、乱獲によりたびたび禁漁が行われ、他産地からの輸入が増加している。
sen.e: In recent years, import from Africa and Morocco have increased to a level surpassing 60 percent of the whole production, but fishing prohibitions due to overfishing have been frequent, and import from other production centers are increasing.

In recent years, imports from Africa and Morocco have increased to a level surpassing 60 percent of the whole production, but fishing prohibitions due to overfishing have been frequent, and imports from other production centers are increasing.

sen.j: 加熱調理されることが多く、多くの種は茹でると鮮紅色を呈する。
sen.e: It is frequently cooked, and most types turn scarlet when boiled.
It is frequently cooked, and most types turn scarlet when boiled.
It is frequently cooked, and most types turn scarlet when boiled.

sen.j: 料理では刺身、寿司、酢だこ、煮だこ、おでんの具材に用いられる。
sen.e: In terms of cooking, it is used as an ingredient for sashimi, sushi, vinegared octopus, boiled octopus, and oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).

In terms of cooking, it is used as an ingredient for sashimi, sushi, vinegared octopus, boiled octopus, and oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy sauce, sugar, sake, etc.).

sen.j: たこ焼きやその原型とされる玉子焼 (明石市)の具材としても親しまれている。
sen.e: It is also popular as an ingredient for takoyaki (octopus dumplings) and for tamagoyaki (round balls made from eggs, flour, etc.) (Akashi City), which is thought to be the origin of takoyaki.
sen.cmt: 用語集の玉子焼が"fried eggs"となっていましたが、意味がことなるため tamagoyaki のままとしました。
sen.e: It is also popular as an ingredient for takoyaki (octopus dumplings) and for tamagoyaki (round balls made from eggs, flour, etc.) (Akashi City), which is thought to be the origin of takoyaki.

sen.j: 低カロリーで、タンパク質、特にタウリンが豊富である。
sen.e: It is low in calories, but rich in protein and especially taurine.
It is low in calories, but rich in protein and especially taurine.
It is low in calories, but rich in protein and especially taurine.

sen.j: また亜鉛も多く含む。
sen.e: It also contains a lot of zinc.
It also contains a lot of zinc.
It also contains a lot of zinc.

sen.j: 夏場のものが特に美味とされる。
sen.e: The ones captured during the summertime are considered especially tasty.
The ones captured during the summertime are considered especially tasty.
The ones captured during the summertime are considered especially tasty.

sen.j: 関西地方には、半夏にタコを食べる習慣があるが、これはタウリンを補給して夏バテを防ぐためといわれる。
sen.e: In the Kansai region, there is a custom of eating an octopus on hange (45 days into geango, a 90 days summer seclusion), but it is said that this is to supplement taurine and to prevent summer heat fatigue.
sen.cmt: 用語集の「夏バテ」が "suffering from the summer heat"とありましたが、ここは夏バテ防止の話であるため、"summer heat fatigue"としました。
sen.e: In the Kansai region, there is a custom of eating an octopus on hange (45 days into geango, a 90 days summer seclusion), but it is said that this is to supplement taurine and to prevent summer heat fatigue.

In the Kansai region, there is a custom of eating an octopus on hange (45 days into geango, a 90 days summer seclusion), but it is said that this is to supplement taurine and to prevent summer heat fatigue.

sen.j: 秋口にメスの体内にある卵は象牙色の袋に包まれており、タコの袋児（ふくろご）と呼ばれ、煮付けて食べる。
sen.e: Eggs found inside the body of a female in early autumn are wrapped in an ivory colored sac and are called the octopus' fukurogo ("sac child"); these are eaten boiled with soy sauce and sugar.
sen.cmt: 「袋児」を "sac child" としました。
sen.e: Eggs found inside the body of a female in early autumn are wrapped in an ivory colored sac and are called the octopus' fukurogo ("sac child"); these are eaten boiled with soy sauce and sugar.

sen.j: また、産卵後の卵はその形状から海藤花（かいとうげ）と呼ばれ、塩漬けにする。
sen.e: Also, spawned eggs are called kaitoge ("sea wisteria flower") from their shape, and these are soused.
Also, spawned eggs are called kaitoge ("sea wisteria flower") from their shape, and these are soused.

sen.j: 欧米
sen.e: Europe and America
Europe and America

sen.j: イギリスやドイツでは悪魔の魚と呼ばれるなど、その外見が忌み嫌われ食べることは控えられていたが、寿司店などの日本料理店では消費されるようになっている。
sen.e: Called "devil fish" in England and Germany, it has been anathema to many due to its appearance and has been avoided for consumption, but it is beginning to be consumed at Japanese restaurants such as the sushi shops.

sen.j: スペインやメキシコなどの欧米諸国でもタコを食べる地域がある。
sen.e: There are also regions in the western countries such as Spain and Mexico that consume octopus.
There are also regions in the western countries such as Spain and Mexico that consume octopus.

sen.j: 特にスペインガリシア州のポルボ・ア・フェイラ（Polbo á feira ガリシア語でタコの市場風の意）、ガリシア以外で「ガリシア風タコ」と呼ばれる茹で蛸料理が有名である。
sen.e: Boiled octopus dish in the Galician region of Spain that is called 'Polbo á feira' (literally "fair style octopus" in Galician), or 'Galician style octopus' outside the Galician region, is especially famous.

A boiled octopus dish in the Galician region of Spain called 'Polbo á feira' (literally "fair style octopus" in Galician), or 'Galician style octopus' outside the Galician region, is especially famous.

sen.j: 他にもギリシャなど正教会信者が多い地域では、斎の間は肉（大斎の際は魚も）を禁じられているが、タコやイカなどは問題無いため、タコを使った伝統料理が多い。
sen.e: In regions such as Greece where there are many believers of the Orthodox Church, there are many traditional foods that use octopus; while meat is prohibited during Lent (during Great Lent/Great Fast, even fish is prohibited), there is no such problem with octopus or squid.
sen.cmt: 用語集に「斎」がないため「Lent」としました。「大斎」は "Great Lent"の方が一般的のようです。いずれにせよ、「斎」の用語と合わせたいです。
sen.e: In regions such as Greece where there are many believers of the Orthodox Church, there are many traditional foods that use octopus; while meat is prohibited during Lent (during Great Lent/Great Fast, even fish is prohibited), there is no such problem with octopus or squid.

sen.j: 大韓民国では日常的な食材で、加熱しないで活きたままぶつ切りにして踊り食いをするサンナクチ（活きたイイダコの意）が有名。
sen.e: Octopus is an everyday cooking ingredient in Republic of Korea, and sannakuchi (Korean word. live octopus ocellatus) dish in which the octopus is cut into pieces and eaten alive is famous.

sen.j: 台湾や中国で消費されるタコは、大部分が現地の日本料理店や韓国料理店の食材であり、中華の伝統食に蛸料理はない。
sen.e: There are no octopus dishes in Chinese traditional foods, and most octopuses that are consumed in Taiwan and China are cooking ingredients used by Japanese and Korean restaurants in that region.

sen.j: 狭い岩の隙間に潜り込む習性を利用した蛸壺、蛸箱漁業は、タコ漁業独特のものである。
sen.e: Octopus trap pot and trap box fishery that use octopus behavior of hiding between narrow rock crevices are unique to octopus fishery.

sen.j: また、餌をつけない針金で引っ掛ける「から釣り漁法」も存在する。
sen.e: Empty fishing method' that hooks the octopus with a wire with no bait also exists.
sen.cmt: 文が途中で分割されていました。
sen.e: There is also an 'empty fishing method' that hooks the octopus with a wire with no bait.
There is also an 'empty fishing method' that hooks the octopus with a wire with no bait.

sen.j: 空の蛸壺が浜辺に積まれている光景は、一部の地域では漁村景観の一つともなっている。
sen.e: The sight of empty octopus trap pots being piled on the beach has become part of the fishing village scenery in some regions.

sen.j: また、イイダコは白色を好む傾向が強く、ラッキョウ等の白色の物体に針をつけ、それに抱きつくイイダコを釣る変形のルアー釣りも有名。
sen.e: Also, Octopus ocellatus has a strong preference for white colors, and an irregular form of lure fishing where a needle is applied to a white object such as Japanese leek (edible plant, Allium bakeri, Allium chinense) and used to fish the octopus that wraps itself around it is also famous.
sen.cmt: 用語集の「ルアー釣り」が " karazuri fishing method (fishing without hook)"となっていますが、普通に"lure fishing"でよいと思われます。

sen.j: 第2位 - 宗谷岬（北海道）
sen.e: 2nd - Soya misaki (Hokkaido)
sen.cmt: 用語集の「宗谷岬」の「岬」が"misaki" のままになっていますが、"cape" とするべきではないでしょうか。
sen.e: 2nd - Soya misaki (Hokkaido)
2nd - Soya-misaki Cape (Hokkaido)
sen.cmt: 翻訳者コメントに従い、Soya misaki→Soya-misaki Capeとしました。

sen.j: 第3位 - 落石漁港（北海道）
sen.e: 3rd - Ochiishi fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)
3rd - Ochiishi fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)
3rd - Ochiishi fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)

sen.j: 第4位 - 八戸漁港（青森県）
sen.e: 4th - Hachinohe fishing port (Aomori Prefecture)
4th - Hachinohe fishing port (Aomori Prefecture)
4th - Hachinohe fishing port (Aomori Prefecture)

sen.j: 第5位 - 庶野漁港（北海道）
sen.e: 5th - Shoya fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)
5th - Shoya fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)
5th - Shoya fishing port (Hokkaido Prefecture)

sen.j: その形態、生態がきわめて特徴的でユーモラスでもあり、また茹でると真っ赤になるなどの性質から、よく漫画や映画、テレビでキャラクター化される（しばしば胴体に鉢巻を巻いた姿で描かれる）。
sen.e: It is often depicted as a character in comics, movies and television because its form and ecology are so unique and humorous, and because it has a characteristic of becoming bright red when boiled (it is frequently portrayed as a figure with a hachimaki headband wrapped around its torso).

It is often depicted as a character in comics, movies and television because its form and ecology are so unique and humorous, and because it has a characteristic of becoming bright red when boiled (it is frequently portrayed as a figure with a hachimaki headband wrapped around its torso).

It is often depicted as a character in comics, movies and television because its form and ecology are so unique and humorous, and because it has a characteristic of becoming bright red when boiled (it is frequently portrayed as a figure with a hachimaki headband wrapped around its torso).

sen.j: 同じ墨を吐く動物として、イカと対比されることが多い。
sen.e: It is often compared to squid as an animal that similarly spews ink clouds.
It is often compared to squid as an animal that similarly spews ink clouds.
